attributes.action: Evaluate training, education and enforcement of anti racism in all sectors.
attributes.additional_details: This needs to be treated as major problem requiring a full task force and complete overhaul of our legislation. Clearly, from the time we are children, until we are adults, something is going wrong along the way to prevent racism. I grew up with compulsive PHSCE classes and being taught about diversity and colonialism. However, I believe racial abuse and inequality is not viewed seriously enough and within workplaces and schools, there needs to be a better system in place to prevent racial inequality.
attributes.background: Currently, there are evident racial inequalities issues across the UK.  There have been petitions regarding curriculums, and police violence.  However, I ask the government to review all sectors- education, healthcare, the workplace, and establish why so much racial inequality is present in the UK.

rejection.details: You could start a petition calling for the Government to commission an independent review into racism in a specified area of the public sector e.g. education or the NHS, if you wished. We have published this petition calling for such a review of the police, which you could sign if you wished: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324314.
